epics.Summary: Trust OS v1 Contract + Gate Hardening
epics.Description: Close remaining Trust OS v1 governance and verification gaps by formalizing hard guarantees, authority boundaries, adapter invariants, and no-bypass evidence gates.

tickets.Summary: Publish canonical Trust OS v1 contract document
tickets.Description: Freeze a single v1 contract document defining hard guarantees, explicit non-goals, fail-closed semantics, and deterministic evidence requirements.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Contract doc is published in docs with in-scope and out-of-scope boundaries; fail-closed guarantees are explicit; release checklist references the contract as a required artifact.

tickets.Summary: Add numeric SLO thresholds for Trust OS runtime and onboarding
tickets.Description: Define and enforce numeric thresholds for policy latency, deterministic hash stability, dispute SLA timing, and time-to-first-verified-receipt.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: SLO thresholds are documented and measured; CI gates fail when threshold checks regress; weekly reports include baseline and delta per SLO.

tickets.Summary: Enforce authority boundary contract for signer and emergency controls
tickets.Description: Codify who can sign policy, who can rotate/revoke keys, and who can trigger pause/quarantine/kill controls, with rollback requirements.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Authority model is documented and tested; unauthorized signer/control actions fail with stable codes; rollback path is verified in automated test flow.

tickets.Summary: Require adapter invariant conformance for new rail lanes
tickets.Description: Block adapter promotion unless shared trust-kernel invariants pass for policy enforcement, replay protection, receipt determinism, and reversal idempotency.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Adapter conformance suite runs in CI for each lane; merge/release fails on invariant regression; report artifact includes invariant IDs and failed surfaces.

tickets.Summary: Add no-bypass negative matrix for MCP and bridge paths
tickets.Description: Add explicit deny/challenge bypass attempts across stdio MCP, HTTP MCP bridge, and paid tool bridges to prove policy runtime cannot be skipped.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Negative matrix test suite covers stdio and HTTP paths; all bypass attempts fail deterministically with stable reason codes; suite is included in required release gates.

tickets.Summary: Add deterministic repeat-run export soak check
tickets.Description: Stress deterministic export paths with repeated runs and assert stable canonical hashes for equivalent inputs.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Repeated export runs for fixed fixtures produce identical canonical hashes; drift is surfaced with artifact diffs; soak check is release-blocking.
